results.title: How ‘Rage’ Challenged Bob Woodward
results.abstract: He has covered nine presidents over 50 years, making him perhaps the country’s most enduring chronicler of the Oval Office. His latest is yet another best seller, drawing praise and criticism along the way.

multimedia.caption: “What Trump has done, particularly on the virus — I have lots of emotions and reporter’s conclusions about it, but I’m embarrassed for him. I am embarrassed for the country,” Bob Woodward said.
multimedia.copyright: Jared Soares for The New York Times

results.title: The First Photos of Enslaved People Raise Many Questions About the Ethics of Viewing

results.title: Sometimes, the Funny Thing About Poetry Is the Poems
results.abstract: Two debut collections, Sumita Chakraborty’s “Arrow” and Chessy Normile’s “Great Exodus, Great Wall, Great Party,” both show that humor can be a valuable weapon in a serious poet’s arsenal.
des_facet: Great Exodus, Great Wall, Great Party (Book)

multimedia.caption: Humor can be used as a defense mechanism, but it’s also a reclamation of control — a refusal to be told how to feel about your own lived (and relived) experience.

results.title: Terry Goodkind, Master of Fantasy Fiction, Is Dead at 72
results.abstract: His epic series “The Sword of Truth” spanned 17 books and sold more than 25 million copies worldwide. But his views angered some readers.

multimedia.caption: The author Terry Goodkind at his home in Nevada in 2016. His fantasy novels were popular, one critic wrote, “in part because, in a complicated world, he boils things down to stark contrasts.”

results.title: Remembering a Father’s Love of the Dystopian
results.abstract: In the middle of a plague, a son thinks back to the way his father devoured any book that intimated disaster was near.

results.title: Cat Bordhi, Who Challenged Traditional Ways of Knitting, Dies at 69
results.abstract: Confounded by the complicated instructions that had become the standard, she thought up whimsical new techniques to create socks, scarves and other items.

multimedia.caption: Cat Bordhi on San Juan Island, Wash., in 2015. The books she published about knitting earned her a devoted following.

results.title: Booker Prize Is Rescheduled to Make Way for Obama’s Memoir
results.abstract: During one busy week in November, the former president’s new book is expected to come out, and top prizes from the Booker and the National Book Awards will be announced.
